intro: Rhexia myrtoidea, commonly known as the pinkroot, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pinkish to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a distinctive reddish root system, which is both its common name and a notable botanical feature. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and prefers partial to full shade. Rhexia myrtoidea is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in rich, organic soil.
